description: Runs an on-demand evaluation for the specified resource to determine whether the resource details will comply with configured Config rules. You can also use it for evaluation purposes. Config recommends using an evaluation context. It runs an execution against the resource details with all of the Config rules in your account that match with the specified proactive mode and resource type.

parameters.name: ResourceDetails
parameters.description: Returns a ResourceDetails object. A unique resource ID for an evaluation. The type of resource being evaluated. The resource definition to be evaluated as per the resource configuration schema type. ResourceConfigurationSchemaType (string) --- The schema type of the resource configuration.

nested_params.name: ResourceId
nested_params.description: A unique resource ID for an evaluation.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource being evaluated.

nested_params.name: ResourceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The resource definition to be evaluated as per the resource configuration schema type.

nested_params.name: ResourceConfigurationSchemaType
nested_params.description: The schema type of the resource configuration.

parameters.name: EvaluationContext
parameters.description: Returns an EvaluationContext object. EvaluationContextIdentifier (string) --- A unique EvaluationContextIdentifier ID for an EvaluationContext.

nested_params.name: EvaluationContextIdentifier
nested_params.description: A unique EvaluationContextIdentifier ID for an EvaluationContext.

parameters.name: EvaluationMode
parameters.description: The mode of an evaluation. The valid values for this API are DETECTIVE and PROACTIVE.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A client token is a unique, case-sensitive string of up to 64 ASCII characters. To make an idempotent API request using one of these actions, specify a client token in the request.

nested_items.name: ResourceEvaluationId
nested_items.description: A unique ResourceEvaluationId that is associated with a single execution.
